item.title: New Zealand reaches 100-day milestone without virus transmission
item.description: New Zealand marked 100 days on Sunday with no recorded cases of the coronavirus in the community but health officials warned there was no room for complacency.

item.title: Bulacan Provincial Capitol Main Building to close from Aug. 10 to 14 for disinfection
item.description: The Bulacan Provincial Capitol Main Building in Malolos, Bulacan will be closed temporarily from August 10 to 14 to give way to disinfection,

item.title: TESDA producing 50M face masks to be distributed for free --official
item.description: The government has commissioned the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority to produce 50 million pieces of reusable face masks to be distributed to the public for free, a TESDA official said Sunday.

item.title: P17M worth of ecstasy pills intercepted in Clark
item.description: Operatives from the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency and the Bureau of Customs - Clark International Airport intercepted on Saturday two parcels with 10,000 tablets of ecstasy pills worth P17 million.

item.title: PNP mourns death of ex-DILG secretary Alfredo Lim
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Saturday expressed grief over the death of former Department of the Interior and Local Government Secretary Alfredo Lim.

item.title: NDRRMC to public, LGUs: Observe COVID-19 health rules amid storm
item.description: The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council reminded the public and local government units to observe COVID-19 health measures in case of evacuation due to the effects of Tropical Storm Enteng.

item.title: Go confident Morales will still help in PhilHealth probe despite illness
item.description: Senator Bong Go believes that Philippine Health Insurance Corp. chief Ricardo Morales will still cooperate in the ongoing Senate investigation into the alleged irregularities in the agency despite his medical condition.

item.title: Isko honors late Mayor Lim for dedicated service to Manila
item.description: Manila mayor Isko Moreno on Sunday honored the late Mayor Alfredo Lim for his contribution to the development of the city.

item.title: Foreign spouses, minor children of Filipinos need entry visa to Philippines --BI
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration on Saturday said foreign spouses and minor children of Filipinos need entry visas before they will be allowed to enter the country effective Sunday, August 9, 2020.

item.title: Iloilo school's rule on homosexuality draws criticism from several groups
item.description: Catholic school Assumption Iloilo included homosexuality as a ground for expulsion as stated in its handbook for students and employees, which received backlash from several groups.

item.title: China reports 23 new COVID-19 cases in mainland, total cases now 84,619
item.description: China reported 23 new coronavirus cases in the mainland for August 8, down from 31 a day earlier, the country s health authority said on Sunday.

item.title: 2 drug suspek arestado sa Maynila; P68k halaga ng droga nasamsam
item.description: Arestado ang dalawang drug suspects sa isinagawang buy-bust operation ng mga pulis-Maynila madaling-araw nitong araw ng Linggo.

item.title: Bayanihan 2 funding could've been higher if gov't had more resources --Zubiri
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel Zubiri on Sunday admitted that the funding for the proposed Bayanihan to Recover As One Act could have been higher if the government had more resources.

item.title: Pateros residents required to wear face shields; violators face P2k fine or 12-hour jail time
item.description: Residents in the municipality of Pateros are now required to wear face shields aside from face masks, according to a report by Mai Bermudez on 24 Oras Weekend on Saturday.

item.title: Medical condition of PhilHealth chief Morales, exec should not be questioned --Lacson
item.description: For Senator Panfilo Lacson, the health condition of Philippine Health Insurance Corporation chief Ricardo Morales and executive vice president Arnel De Jesus should not be questioned even as these came at a time when the agency is being investigated over its alleged irregularities.
